channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: Explaining black box text modules in natural language with language models
item.description: Here, we ask whether we can automatically obtain natural language explanations for black box text modules.

item.title: Rethinking Data Augmentation for Tabular Data in Deep Learning
item.description: In the existing literature on self-supervised learning for tabular data, contrastive learning is the predominant method.

item.title: MetaModulation: Learning Variational Feature Hierarchies for Few-Shot Learning with Fewer Tasks
item.description: To account for the uncertainty caused by the limited training tasks, we propose a variational MetaModulation where the modulation parameters are treated as latent variables.

item.title: Complementary Classifier Induced Partial Label Learning
item.description: complementary labels), which accurately indicates a set of labels that do not belong to a sample.

item.title: Algorithms for Boolean Matrix Factorization using Integer Programming
item.description: Boolean matrix factorization (BMF) approximates a given binary input matrix as the product of two smaller binary factors.

item.title: OpenSLU: A Unified, Modularized, and Extensible Toolkit for Spoken Language Understanding
item.description: Spoken Language Understanding (SLU) is one of the core components of a task-oriented dialogue system, which aims to extract the semantic meaning of user queries (e. g., intents and slots).

item.title: Clustering-Aware Negative Sampling for Unsupervised Sentence Representation
item.description: Contrastive learning has been widely studied in sentence representation learning.

item.title: Boosting Distress Support Dialogue Responses with Motivational Interviewing Strategy
item.description: AI-driven chatbots have become an emerging solution to address psychological distress.

item.title: Additive manifesto decomposition: A policy domain aware method for understanding party positioning
item.description: The workflow covers (a) definition of suitable policy domains; (b) automatic labeling of domains, if no manual labels are available; (c) computation of domain-level similarities and aggregation at a global level; (d) extraction of interpretable party positions on major policy axes via multidimensional scaling.

item.title: What You See is What You Read? Improving Text-Image Alignment Evaluation
item.description: Automatically determining whether a text and a corresponding image are semantically aligned is a significant challenge for vision-language models, with applications in generative text-to-image and image-to-text tasks.

item.title: PMC-VQA: Visual Instruction Tuning for Medical Visual Question Answering
item.description: In this paper, we focus on the problem of Medical Visual Question Answering (MedVQA), which is crucial in efficiently interpreting medical images with vital clinic-relevant information.

item.title: Evaluating Object Hallucination in Large Vision-Language Models
item.description: Despite the promising progress on LVLMs, we find that LVLMs suffer from the hallucination problem, i. e. they tend to generate objects that are inconsistent with the target images in the descriptions.

item.title: Improving Language Model Negotiation with Self-Play and In-Context Learning from AI Feedback
item.description: We study whether multiple large language models (LLMs) can autonomously improve each other in a negotiation game by playing, reflecting, and criticizing.

item.title: A Modular and High-Resolution Time-Frequency Post-Processing Technique
item.description: In this letter, based on the variational model, we propose a novel time-frequency post-processing technique to approximate the ideal time-frequency representation.

item.title: Multi-Grained Knowledge Retrieval for End-to-End Task-Oriented Dialog
item.description: Retrieving proper domain knowledge from an external database lies at the heart of end-to-end task-oriented dialog systems to generate informative responses.

item.title: AD-KD: Attribution-Driven Knowledge Distillation for Language Model Compression
item.description: To enhance the knowledge transfer of model reasoning and generalization, we further explore multi-view attribution distillation on all potential decisions of the teacher.

item.title: Are You Copying My Model? Protecting the Copyright of Large Language Models for EaaS via Backdoor Watermark
item.description: Companies have begun to offer Embedding as a Service (EaaS) based on these LLMs, which can benefit various natural language processing (NLP) tasks for customers.

item.title: Can Language Models Solve Graph Problems in Natural Language?
item.description: We then propose Build-a-Graph Prompting and Algorithmic Prompting, two instruction-based approaches to enhance LLMs in solving natural language graph problems.

item.title: Pittsburgh Learning Classifier Systems for Explainable Reinforcement Learning: Comparing with XCS
item.description: Learning Classifier Systems (LCSs) are evolutionary machine learning systems that can be categorised as eXplainable AI (XAI) due to their rule-based nature.

item.title: SIMGA: A Simple and Effective Heterophilous Graph Neural Network with Efficient Global Aggregation
item.description: Graph neural networks (GNNs) realize great success in graph learning but suffer from performance loss when meeting heterophily, i. e. neighboring nodes are dissimilar, due to their local and uniform aggregation.

item.title: Demonstration-free Autonomous Reinforcement Learning via Implicit and Bidirectional Curriculum
item.description: While reinforcement learning (RL) has achieved great success in acquiring complex skills solely from environmental interactions, it assumes that resets to the initial state are readily available at the end of each episode.

item.title: Predicting Tweet Engagement with Graph Neural Networks
item.description: Social Networks represent one of the most important online sources to share content across a world-scale audience.

item.title: Restoring Images Captured in Arbitrary Hybrid Adverse Weather Conditions in One Go
item.description: On the other hand, we establish a new dataset, termed HAC, for learning and benchmarking arbitrary Hybrid Adverse Conditions restoration.

item.title: Shielded Representations: Protecting Sensitive Attributes Through Iterative Gradient-Based Projection
item.description: In this work, we propose Iterative Gradient-Based Projection (IGBP), a novel method for removing non-linear encoded concepts from neural representations.

item.title: An efficient solver for ASP(Q)
item.description: In this paper, we present a new implementation that builds on the ideas of qasp and features both a more efficient encoding procedure and new optimized encodings of ASP(Q) programs in QBF.

item.title: Explainable Multi-Agent Reinforcement Learning for Temporal Queries
item.description: As multi-agent reinforcement learning (MARL) systems are increasingly deployed throughout society, it is imperative yet challenging for users to understand the emergent behaviors of MARL agents in complex environments.

item.title: BASEN: Time-Domain Brain-Assisted Speech Enhancement Network with Convolutional Cross Attention in Multi-talker Conditions
item.description: In this paper, we thus propose a novel time-domain brain-assisted SE network (BASEN) incorporating electroencephalography (EEG) signals recorded from the listener for extracting the target speaker from monaural speech mixtures.

item.title: Model-based Validation as Probabilistic Inference
item.description: Estimating the distribution over failures is a key step in validating autonomous systems.

item.title: SS-BSN: Attentive Blind-Spot Network for Self-Supervised Denoising with Nonlocal Self-Similarity
item.description: However, these methods rely on large-scale noisy-clean image pairs, which are difficult to obtain in practice.

item.title: BAD: BiAs Detection for Large Language Models in the context of candidate screening
item.description: Application Tracking Systems (ATS) have allowed talent managers, recruiters, and college admissions committees to process large volumes of potential candidate applications efficiently.

item.title: Rethinking the Open-Loop Evaluation of End-to-End Autonomous Driving in nuScenes
item.description: Our observation also indicates that we need to rethink the current open-loop evaluation scheme of end-to-end autonomous driving in nuScenes.

item.title: Deep and Fast Approximate Order Independent Transparency
item.description: We present a machine learning approach for efficiently computing order independent transparency (OIT).

item.title: Balancing Lexical and Semantic Quality in Abstractive Summarization
item.description: Previous works have mostly specified the rank through the ROUGE score and aligned candidate summaries, but there can be quite a large gap between the lexical overlap metric and semantic similarity.

item.title: Pyramid Diffusion Models For Low-light Image Enhancement
item.description: Recovering noise-covered details from low-light images is challenging, and the results given by previous methods leave room for improvement.

item.title: M3KE: A Massive Multi-Level Multi-Subject Knowledge Evaluation Benchmark for Chinese Large Language Models
item.description: Comprehensively evaluating the capability of large language models in multiple tasks is of great importance.

item.title: DeepMSS: Deep Multi-Modality Segmentation-to-Survival Learning for Survival Outcome Prediction from PET/CT Images
item.description: Instead of adopting MTL, we propose a novel Segmentation-to-Survival Learning (SSL) strategy, where our DeepMSS is trained for tumor segmentation and survival prediction sequentially.

item.title: Cold PAWS: Unsupervised class discovery and the cold-start problem
item.description: In many machine learning applications, labeling datasets can be an arduous and time-consuming task.

item.title: Binarized Spectral Compressive Imaging
item.description: Finally, our BiSRNet is derived by using the proposed techniques to binarize the base model.

item.title: Smart Word Suggestions for Writing Assistance
item.description: The training dataset comprises over 3. 7 million sentences and 12. 7 million suggestions generated through rules.

item.title: EfficientSCI: Densely Connected Network with Space-time Factorization for Large-scale Video Snapshot Compressive Imaging
item.description: We are the first time to show that an UHD color video with high compression ratio can be reconstructed from a snapshot 2D measurement using a single end-to-end deep learning model with PSNR above 32 dB.

item.title: An Ensemble Deep Learning Approach for COVID-19 Severity Prediction Using Chest CT Scans
item.description: Chest X-rays have been widely used for COVID-19 screening; however, 3D computed tomography (CT) is a more effective modality.

item.title: An Interactively Reinforced Paradigm for Joint Infrared-Visible Image Fusion and Saliency Object Detection
item.description: Their common characteristic of seeking complementary cues from different source images motivates us to explore the collaborative relationship between Fusion and Salient object detection tasks on infrared and visible images via an Interactively Reinforced multi-task paradigm for the first time, termed IRFS.

item.title: FastComposer: Tuning-Free Multi-Subject Image Generation with Localized Attention
item.description: FastComposer proposes delayed subject conditioning in the denoising step to maintain both identity and editability in subject-driven image generation.

item.title: LeTI: Learning to Generate from Textual Interactions
item.description: LeTI iteratively fine-tunes the model, using the LM objective, on a concatenation of natural language instructions, LM-generated programs, and textual feedback, which is only provided when the generated program fails to solve the task.

item.title: A Genetic Fuzzy System for Interpretable and Parsimonious Reinforcement Learning Policies
item.description: Results show the system is able to effectively explore the trade-off between policy performance and complexity, and learn interpretable, high-performing policies that use as few rules as possible.

item.title: Accelerating Transformer Inference for Translation via Parallel Decoding
item.description: We propose to reframe the standard greedy autoregressive decoding of MT with a parallel formulation leveraging Jacobi and Gauss-Seidel fixed-point iteration methods for fast inference.

item.title: CoEdIT: Text Editing by Task-Specific Instruction Tuning
item.description: Text editing or revision is an essential function of the human writing process.

item.title: HICO-DET-SG and V-COCO-SG: New Data Splits to Evaluate Systematic Generalization in Human-Object Interaction Detection
item.description: To address this issue, we created two new sets of HOI detection data splits named HICO-DET-SG and V-COCO-SG based on HICO-DET and V-COCO datasets.

item.title: Dynamics of niche construction in adaptable populations evolving in diverse environments
item.description: In this work, we study NC in simulation environments that consist of multiple, diverse niches and populations that evolve their plasticity, evolvability and niche-constructing behaviors.

item.title: Measuring Implicit Bias Using SHAP Feature Importance and Fuzzy Cognitive Maps
item.description: In this paper, we integrate the concepts of feature importance with implicit bias in the context of pattern classification.
